elements.title: Isopyrum
elements.contents: ... that a 1920 article segregated members of Isopyrum into the new genus Paraquilegia – assigning it P. grandflorum, P. caespitosa, P. microphylla (example pictured), and P. uniflora – but had the "rather less fortunate" effect of expanding Semiaquilegia beyond S. adoxoides?

elements.title: Ten no Hate Made – Poland Hishi
elements.contents: ... that the publication of Ten no Hate Made – Poland Hishi, the first legally published manga in Poland, has been described as the event that created the manga fandom in the country?

elements.title: Wilson Starbuck
elements.contents: ... that when Wilson Starbuck's play Sea Dogs was staged in 1939 it "contained some of the foulest language heard on Broadway" at that point in history?

elements.title: Geneva Window
elements.contents: ... that Harry Clarke's Geneva Window was never installed in Geneva because of the "grave offense" it might cause?

elements.title: Michal Pivoňka
elements.contents: ... that Michal Pivoňka's father was demoted at work as a result of his son signing with the Washington Capitals?

elements.title: -core
elements.contents: ... that more than 5,000 genres on Spotify use the suffix -core?

elements.title: George L. Wade
elements.contents: ... that blackface minstrel show performer George L. Wade was also a race car manufacturer?

elements.title: transportation during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Paralympics
elements.contents: ... that transportation during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Paralympics accounted for 53 percent of the games' carbon footprint?

elements.title: Tyrannasorus rex
elements.contents: ... that a specimen of Tyrannasorus rex had six legs and wings and was killed by a legume?
